CatDescriptText: Emily Williams, Lawrenceville and Lois Johnson, senior, Sheraden, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that married students of high school age should be permitted to attend school with other students who are single?"  Emily Williams' answer reads: "I think so.  They should have the same rights and privileges of others.  Sometimes, they are not able to attend school until after marriage, because some marry very young."  Lois Johnson's answer reads: "No.  They are older in a way and therefore they don't bother with school activities without their husbands."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Emily Williams wearing light colored beret, eyeglasses, and light colored leather coat with shawl collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Downtown; Portrait of Lois Johnson wearing light colored coat with fur collar, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Downtown
